description: Multiple HR documents with conflicting benefits information
expected_issues: Medical insurance coverage differs: Benefits Guide states full family coverage, Website states employee only, Contract states employee plus spouse
MPF contribution rates don't match across documents

documents.title: Employee Benefits Guide 2024
documents.content:
COMPREHENSIVE BENEFITS PACKAGE

Medical Insurance:
All permanent employees and their eligible family members are covered under our group medical insurance plan from day one of employment.

Coverage includes:
- Employee (100% company-paid)
- Spouse (100% company-paid)
- Dependent children up to age 25 (100% company-paid)
- Parents over 60 (employee pays 50% of premium)

Annual Coverage Limits:
- Outpatient: HK$50,000 per person
- Inpatient: HK$500,000 per person
- Maternity: HK$80,000 per person

Dental Insurance:
Available to all employees after 6 months of service. Coverage includes:
- Annual checkup and cleaning (100% covered)
- Basic procedures (80% covered)
- Major procedures (50% covered)
- Annual limit: HK$15,000 per person

Mandatory Provident Fund (MPF):
The company contributes 10% of your monthly salary to your MPF account, and you contribute 5%. This exceeds the statutory minimum requirement and demonstrates our commitment to your retirement security.

Contributions are calculated on your total monthly salary including bonuses and allowances, up to the statutory maximum of HK$30,000.

Life Insurance:
All employees are covered by group life insurance providing:
- Death benefit: 48 months of basic salary
- Permanent disability: 48 months of basic salary
- Coverage begins on your first day of employment
- No medical examination required

Personal Accident Insurance:
Company-paid coverage of HK$2,000,000 for accidental death or permanent disability, 24/7 worldwide coverage.

documents.title: Standard Employment Contract - Benefits Schedule
documents.content:
APPENDIX B: EMPLOYEE BENEFITS

1. MEDICAL INSURANCE

1.1 The Employer shall provide group medical insurance coverage for the Employee and the Employee's spouse, with premiums fully paid by the Employer.

1.2 Coverage for dependent children may be arranged at the Employee's expense, with the Employer facilitating enrollment through the group plan.

1.3 Medical insurance coverage shall commence on the Employee's first day of employment and continue throughout the employment period.

1.4 Annual benefit limits are:
   a) Outpatient services: HK$50,000 per covered person
   b) Inpatient/hospitalization: HK$500,000 per covered person
   c) Maternity benefits: HK$100,000 per covered person

2. DENTAL INSURANCE

2.1 Dental insurance coverage is available to employees who have completed their probationary period (6 months).

2.2 The Employer pays 100% of premiums for employee coverage. Family members may be enrolled at the Employee's expense.

3. MANDATORY PROVIDENT FUND

3.1 Both the Employer and Employee shall make mandatory contributions to the Employee's MPF account as required under the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485).

3.2 Contribution rates:
   a) Employer contribution: 5% of monthly relevant income
   b) Employee contribution: 5% of monthly relevant income
   c) Subject to minimum and maximum relevant income levels as prescribed by law

3.3 Contributions are calculated on basic monthly salary only and exclude bonuses, commissions, or other variable payments.

4. LIFE INSURANCE

4.1 The Employer provides group life insurance coverage equal to forty-eight (48) months of the Employee's basic monthly salary.

4.2 Coverage includes death benefit and total permanent disability benefit.

4.3 The Employee may designate beneficiaries by completing the required insurance forms.

5. PERSONAL ACCIDENT INSURANCE

5.1 Coverage amount: HK$2,000,000 for accidental death or permanent total disability

5.2 Coverage applies 24 hours a day, worldwide

5.3 Coverage commences on the first day of employment

task.focus: Identify all inconsistencies and discrepancies in medical insurance coverage, MPF contribution rates and calculation methods, dental insurance eligibility, and life insurance coverage amounts across the three documents.
